medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with weakness leading to a near fall last week, followed by shoulder blade pain. The pain then migrated to the abdomen, specifically the right upper quadrant, accompanied by nausea. The patient denies fevers, chills, vomiting, diarrhea, or blood in stool. A recent fall to the buttock this morning prompted hospital admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: IDDM, AFIB on coumadin, asthma/COPD, colon polyp with polypectomy, coronary artery disease s/p stent, CHF with history of depressed EF (improved to 55%), depression, dyspepsia, hypercholesterolemia, hypertension, irritable bowel syndrome, obesity, osteoarthritis, peripheral neuropathy.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at age unknown after several strokes and an MI with a history of diabetes. Mother died at age unknown from a stroke. All siblings suffer from hypertension; one sister died of an MI at age unknown with a history of diabetes, and one brother has diabetes. No significant family history for hyperlipidemia or early MI.
